TOCEntry.title: Scope
TOCEntry.content:
This document is the deliverable of the third step of the OpenFlexo Process Mapping Approach. It aims at answering the following question:

How do we represent the process? ... or how do we describe with precision the set of resources (human and material) required to reach the objectives?

The aim of the third step is to map, i.e. to model the processes identified in the previous step. In other words, we seek to describe in details how the processes run, what happens inside them.

To do this, we will review

  • What are the concepts used to describe the processes?
  • How to describe the processes?
  • What are the expected deliverables?

An iterative and incremental approach is implemented in the modeling process (3rd stage of the approach combining Process mapping, rapid Storyboaroding/Prototyping and Validation) to:

  • frequently check the accuracy of the model with users;
  • record the changes requested by users as soon as possible.

TOCEntry.title: Concepts
TOCEntry.content:
Processes are described with OpenFlexo using the Business Process Modeling Notatino (BPMN). It combines activities, gateways, flows, messages, events and artifacts. Best practice: a process should not contain more than ten activities.

An activity is described as follows:

  • NAME: identifies the activity in a unique way. Best practice: always use an infinitive verb - noun (e.g. Reject request) because the activity describes an action to be performed.
  • DESCRIPTION: a short text explaining what the activity does.
  • BUSINESS  RULE (optional): This description can be augmented by some business rules.
  • ROLE: a group of actors in charge of the activity execution.
  • TOOL: (Optional): Technical means allowing the realization of the activity.

Modeling best practices for the third step

The process activity flows is modelled in OpenFlexo by connecting activities with gateways, events or other activities etc.

This third step table of content is associated with the "Business" documentation target.

Activities use the following OpenFlexo fields for defining the previously defined attributes:

  • a name used as the NAME,
  • a general description is used as the DESCRIPTION,
  • the "Business" target description for the BUSINESS  RULES,
  • the OpenFlexo  role defined in the previous step for the ROLE.

Organization units and Roles sections are automatically generated from the OpenFlexo  workflow editor role perspective. Arrows should go from organization units to roles.

Organisation units and roles attributes are both encode in OpenFlexo  as follows:

  • DESCRIPTION  is a combination of the general and "User Manual" target description.
  • OBJECTIVES are specified in the "Objectives" target description.

DDescribes the roles using the RACI model for identifying roles and responsabilities. sRACI is an abbreviation for:

  • R = Responsible – owns the problem / project.
  • A= to who “R” is Accountable – who must sign off (Approve) on work before it is effective.
  • C = to be Consulted – has information and/or capability necessary to complete the work.
  • I = to be Informed – must be notified of the results, but need not be consulted.

The RACI chart crosses the activities and the roles by attributing to each case a R, A, C or I responsibility.
